summary:
• The Taliban restricts opportunities for Afghan women, forcing them to live secret lives.
• Many Afghan women turn to the internet to maintain some autonomy and freedom.
• Online platforms provide a space for Afghan women to connect with others who share similar experiences and challenges.

• Projections show that France's left alliance has taken a surprise lead.
• The French have rejected the far-right again.
• There was jubilation and stunned silence as the results were announced.

• Viktor Orban visits Moscow
• Angers EU allies
• Hungry leader visits Russia

• In rural areas, women accused of witchcraft face murder and violence from their own families over disputes about land ownership.
• Fetching water for household chores is a significant obstacle to education and economic opportunities for Indian women, particularly in rural areas where access to clean drinking water is limited.
• The lack of access to basic amenities like clean water hinders girls' ability to attend school regularly, perpetuating cycles of poverty and inequality.

• Iranian reformist wins presidency, seeking engagement with the West.
• Low voter turnout may indicate discontent among voters or apathy towards politics in Iran.
• The election process is overseen by the Guardian Council, ensuring candidates meet strict criteria before being approved.

• Israeli-Hamas talks resume, then adjourn again amid muted optimism
• Resumption of talks follows recent tensions between Israel and Hamas in Gaza Strip
• Uncertainty surrounds future prospects for agreement or truce between both sides

• Tokyo's first female governor is expected to win her third term after surviving the COVID-19 pandemic and the Olympics.
• Despite winning its "war" against floppy disks, Japan still has an affinity for outdated technology.
• Japan has made progress in modernizing its technology infrastructure despite lingering support for older devices.

• Protests against mass tourism in Barcelona
• Demonstrators used water to disrupt tourist activities
• Calls for responsible travel practices in popular destinations

• The woman accused Assange of sexual assault.
• However, she is relieved that he has been released from detention.
• Her accusations were likely due to her belief in the seriousness of the charges against him.

• WTO Chief Warns Against Global Trade Breakdown
• Warning Issued Over Global Economic Disruption Risks 
• Economic Dangers Highlighted By International Organization Head

• New UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer meets the King and gives a speech.
• He gets to work with his newly formed government.
• The 14-year conservative government has significantly impacted British society.

• Western US faces severe heatwaves.
• A young NFL player dies in a car accident.
• A famous movie producer passes away at 63.
• Wrestler John Cena retires from his sport.
• Many Americans struggle with debt just to buy food.
• The Democratic party considers the consequences of losing Joe Biden as their candidate.
